alert.note: Alert for Dorchester (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 14 at 8:13PM EDT until July 15 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Berkeley, Charleston, Colleton and Dorchester. * WHEN...Until 900 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 811 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated a nearly stationary area of thunderstorms with torrential rainfall extending from near Walterboro east to Summerville, North Charleston, Goose Creek and into central portions of Berkeley County. As much as 2 to 4.5 inches of rain has fallen across portions of the area. An additional 1 to 3 inches could fall through 9 PM. The risk for minor flooding of low-lying and poor drainage areas continues. - Cars have been reported as flooded and abandoned on portions of Rivers Avenue near the Northwoods Mall. Some roads are becoming impassable. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... North Charleston, Summerville, Goose Creek, Hanahan, Ladson, I-26/I-526 Interchange, West Ashley, Naval Weapons Station Charleston, Daniel Island, Hollywood, Ravenel, Cottageville, Knightsville, Delemar Crossroads, Jedburg, Givhans, Sangaree, Magnolia Gardens, College Park and Crowfield Plantation.
info.instruction: A Flash Flood Warning may be needed. Be prepared to take action should flooding be observed or if a warning is issued for your area. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Report flooding directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 1-888-383-2024 or email your reports to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
